cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.ST, cs.IT, cs.DS. 

The paper deals with the problem of modeling prior ignorance in statistical inference, which is a fundamental problem in artificial intelligence and machine learning (cs.AI). The focus is on the coherent theory of uncertainty, which is a central topic in statistical learning theory (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the conditions under which learning is possible, which is a key issue in statistical inference (cs.ST). The paper uses information theory to derive a condition that prevents learning under prior near-ignorance, which is a mathematical topic (cs.IT). Finally, the paper deals with latent variables, which are a common topic in data science and machine learning (cs.DS).
